project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We notice that when looking at the set of people who are watchers on a ticket, accounts that are inactive show there. You can hover over the name and it shows they are inactive, but unless you do that the name in the watchers list looks the same as an active user.

This has caused security false alarms here...people see users they know have left the company in the watchers list and they assume someone has re-activated the account. In this case, the list of names should indicate the user is inactive without having to hover over it. 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Specify inactive users in watcher list

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

DVCS doesn't store changesets when the property "RAW_NODE" is an empty string. As a result, the same changes can be processed multiple times without any progress.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup integration with Github
 # Create a branch with multiple commits
 # Synchronize the repository

The problem doesn't occur when using the Oracle database or when integrating with Bitbucket.
h3. Expected Results

DVCS shows the actual number of commits, the changes are persisted in a database.
h3. Actual Results

DVCS finishes synchronization but only one changeset from the branch is persisted. Because other changesets are not stored in, each branch triggers a full synchronization of a whole history, including parent branches. 

+For example, having one master branch with 500 commits and creating 10 branches from the head, results in 5500 commits to synchronize.+ 

This also might cause High CPU utilization on Database server. This is due to queries produces by DVCS:
{noformat}
(@P0 nvarchar(4000),@P3 nvarchar(4000),@P2 nvarchar(4000),@P1 nvarchar(4000))SELECT COUNT FROM jiraschema.AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE messageMapping JOIN jiraschema.AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_TAG messageTag ON messageMapping.ID = messageTag.MESSAGE_ID JOIN jiraschema.AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM messageQueueItem ON messageMapping.ID = messageQueueItem.MESSAGE_ID WHERE messageTag.TAG = @P0 AND messageQueueItem."STATE" in ( @P1, @P2, @P3 )

(@P0 nvarchar(4000),@P1 int,@P2 nvarchar(4000),@P3 nvarchar(4000))SELECT TOP 1 queueItem.RETRIES_COUNT,queueItem."STATE",queueItem.STATE_INFO,queueItem.ID,queueItem.QUEUE,queueItem.LAST_FAILED FROM jiraschema.AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE_QUEUE_ITEM queueItem JOIN jiraschema.AO_E8B6CC_MESSAGE message ON queueItem.MESSAGE_ID = message.ID WHERE message.ADDRESS = @P0 AND message.PRIORITY = @P1 AND queueItem.QUEUE = @P2 AND queueItem."STATE" = @P3 ORDER BY message.ID ASC
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changesets with an empty RAW_NODE are not persisted in database

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User picker doesn't work in "User Workload Report" and "Notification Scheme" 

h3. Environment 

* Reproducible in Chrome & Firefox
* Not reproducible on Jira 8.13.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Use Jira Software over 8.18.1.

h4. User Workload Report
 !userPicker-user_workload_report.gif|thumbnail! 

h4. Notification Scheme
 !userPicker-Notification_scheme.gif|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

User picker works, and you can select user.

h3. Actual Results

The user picker doesn't work, and we need to type the username by myself.

h3. Workaround

Type the username manually.
fields.summary: User picker doesn't work in "User Workload Report" and "Notification Scheme"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a user of a long-lived, product-oriented Jira project, over the course of years I see the backlog growing with many valid stories and bugs. 

Jira provides us mechanisms to manage this complexity, such as quick filters, and filtering by epic or version. 

Like many scrum users, we find it useful to rank the highest-priority items, so that we know what to work on next. 

*However, we are not finding it useful in practice to rank the lowest-priority items among themselves.* By the time we get to these items, today's ranking may no longer be valid, because *change happens.*  ** 

We're finding ourselves sometimes creating a story that exists merely to divide the ranked stories above from the unranked stories beneath.

That marker story helps with the unfiltered backlog – but can disappear with filtering. 

It would be helpful to have explicit support for such a division between the ranked and the unranked parts of the backlog. 

Such a division could also address the question of where new issues are placed before ranking – they're placed in the unranked area. (This can also be addressed with a Review status, but that's not always as obvious as grouping the items into their own area.)

Jira already contains a good model for such a division, between sprints and the backlog. In that case, the demarcation can be dragged to move issues into or out of the sprint. That would be useful for the ranked and unranked backlog as well.
fields.summary: Unranked backlog demarcation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As Jira administrator I want to see the Total number of boards/sprints when using Jira Agile REST API endpoints under /rest/agile/1.0/*

This helps to better work on pagination using both "*startAt*" and "*maxResults*" parameters.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

On Jira Server/Data Center use one the Agile REST API endpoints below:

<BASE-URL>/rest/agile/1.0/board
 <BASE-URL>/rest/agile/1.0/board/\{boardID}/sprint
h3. Expected Results

Application/Json response to include the "Total:" number of board/sprints
{code:json}
{
    "maxResults": 2,
    "startAt": 1,
    "total": 5,        << ----- This number
    "isLast": false,
    "values": [
        {
            "id": 37,
            "self": "http://www.example.com/jira/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/23",
            "state": "closed",
            "name": "sprint 1",
            "startDate": "2015-04-11T15:22:00.000+10:00",
            "endDate": "2015-04-20T01:22:00.000+10:00",
            "completeDate": "2015-04-20T11:04:00.000+10:00",
            "activatedDate": "2015-04-11T15:22:00.000+10:00",
            "originBoardId": 5,
            "goal": "I'm making a note here: HUGE SUCCESS."
        },
        {
            "id": 72,
            "self": "http://www.example.com/jira/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/73",
            "state": "future",
            "name": "sprint 2"
        }
    ]
} {code}
h3. Actual Results

Application/Json response does not return the "Total:" information:
{code:json}
{
    "maxResults": 2,
    "startAt": 1,
    "isLast": false,
    "values": [
        {
            "id": 37,
            "self": "http://www.example.com/jira/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/23",
            "state": "closed",
            "name": "sprint 1",
            "startDate": "2015-04-11T15:22:00.000+10:00",
            "endDate": "2015-04-20T01:22:00.000+10:00",
            "completeDate": "2015-04-20T11:04:00.000+10:00",
            "activatedDate": "2015-04-11T15:22:00.000+10:00",
            "originBoardId": 5,
            "goal": "I'm making a note here: HUGE SUCCESS."
        },
        {
            "id": 72,
            "self": "http://www.example.com/jira/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/73",
            "state": "future",
            "name": "sprint 2"
        }
    ]
} {code}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Agile REST API to return the "Total" number of boards and sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently Jira Data Center does not display values for system load on the Cluster Monitoring page for Windows environments, showing instead a N/A.
The N/A value was added as a part of the fix for JSWSERVER-20669, since Windows does not support properly {{getSystemLoadAverage}} calls used in the Cluster Monitoring plugin.

h3. Suggestion
Implement a feature to allow the Cluster Monitoring to properly display the system load under Windows environments.
[This Stack Overflow thread|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26872306/alternate-of-getsystemloadaverage-for-windows] suggests that it might be possible to use {{com.sun.management.OperatingSystemMXBean.getSystemCpuLoad()}} (or {{getProcessCpuLoad()}} instead of {{java.lang.management.OperatingSystemMXBean.getSystemLoadAverage()}}.
Additionally [this blog post|http://sellmic.com/blog/2011/07/21/hidden-java-7-features-cpu-load-monitoring/] has more information that can help on implementing this suggestion.
fields.summary: Allow Cluster Monitoring page to show the nodes load on Windows environments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When accessing a task with subtasks, the "Bulk operation" button is accessible through more (•••) even if the user does not have the global permission for bulk changes. The user is then taken through the 4 steps of Bulk Change, but unable to finish, as after clicking in "Confirm" the process results on a 404 page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as an user with project access and permission to edit issues;
 # Access an issue with multiple sub-tasks;
 # On the Sub-tasks dropdown, Select ... and choose Bulk operation:
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-31 at 4.32.51 PM.png|width=242,height=364!

h3. Expected Results

When the user does not have the Bulk Change global permission, the option "Bulk operation" should not be displayed on the sub-tasks options, as it's also not displayed when trying to perform the bulk change operation through a search result.
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-31 at 4.43.50 PM.png|width=550,height=228!
h3. Actual Results

The "Bulk operation" not only is accessible, but it will take the user through all of the Bulk Change steps, resulting in an error (404) on the last step, after clicking on "Confirm".
 !Screen Shot 2021-08-31 at 4.45.29 PM.png|width=260,height=226!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior, as the Bulk Operation is not completed even if accessible.
fields.summary: Bulk Operation of subtasks is accessible (although not successful) to users without the Bulk Change permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem

After upgrading Jira from 8.5.1 to 8.16.1, the DVCS links are in the wrong place in _"REPOSITORY_URL"_ column in _"AO_E8B6CC_REPOSITORY_MAPPING"_ Database table.
 The URLs are correct in _"AO_E8B6CC_ORGANIZATION_MAPPING"_.
h3. Environment

Jira 8.16.1 with GitHub repositories.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Not replicable yet in our environments.

We had some references from customers reporting that:
* It failed doing a normal ZDU upgrade from 8.5.1 to 8.16.1;
* All except 9 out of the 3600 repositories ended up pointing to one account.

A few things about this GitHub account that may be pertinent:
* It is the only account name with a hyphen in the name.
* It's the last account alphabetically, which is the order that the accounts show in the "DVCS accounts" screen

h3. Expected Results

The "REPOSITORY_URL" data remains the same after upgrading
h3. Actual Results

The "REPOSITORY_URL" data changed after upgrading.
h3. Workaround

Before modifying anything in the database, we would recommend you do a *FULL database backup*. If not possible, at least do a backup of the tables *AO_E8B6CC_ORGANIZATION_MAPPING* and *AO_E8B6CC_REPOSITORY_MAPPING;*
{panel:title=Database Manipulation}
As with all recommendations made by Premier Support, we suggest following best practices for change management and evaluating these settings in a *test/staging environment* prior to rolling out any changes to a production environment.

Can you confirm if you can reproduce the issue in a staging environment or if you can quickly set up a test environment for applying this fix?
{panel}
Choose 1 impacted link (wrong in REPOSITORY_MAPPING) and:
 * Check If the *"ID"* column from *"_ORGANIZATION_MAPPING"_* table is matching to the *"ORGANIZATION_ID"* column in the _*"AO_E8B6CC_REPOSITORY_MAPPING"*_ table;
 * If it's correct, adjust the "REPOSITORY_URL" data directly in the DB;
 * We have created 1 UPDATE query as a sample (*using Postgresql*). You might need to change to work on your database distribution):

The query below can be used to update/adjust the *REPOSITORY_URL* in table _*AO_E8B6CC_REPOSITORY_MAPPING*_:
{code:sql}
UPDATE "AO_E8B6CC_REPOSITORY_MAPPING" SET "REPOSITORY_URL" = REPLACE ("REPOSITORY_URL",'URL_HERE','NEW_URL_HERE') WHERE "ORGANIZATION_ID"=<<id_here>>;{code}
The query will replace the string *"URL_HERE"* for *"NEW_URL_HERE"* for repositories mapped to DVCS ORGANIZATION ID "id_here".

If it works, you can replicate it to the other "REPOSITORY_URL".
----
h3. Notes

There were quite a few bugs reported against the older DVCS plugin, and due to the [re-design of DVCS in the latest Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-14-x-release-notes-1027133861.html#JiraSoftware8.14.xreleasenotes-dvcs], we occasionally see this type of problem.
fields.summary: DVCS links to GitHub repositories have wrong account after upgrading

When we import a CSV file containing new users (e.g. reporter of an issue that does not have an acount on Jira) the Importer present a choice to import all users as inactive users. However, regardless of the option, the users are imported as active users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Do to Jira and create a new Project.
# Select to *Administration (⚙️)>System>External System Import*
# Import the file saved on Step 6.
# Map the project and Fields to complete the import
# On the screen of what to do with imported users, select the option _"Leave them as inactive for now."_
# Proceed with the import.
# After the import, go to *Administration (⚙️)> User management*

h3. Expected Results

The users created by the CSV import should have been created and set as inactive.

h3. Actual Results

All the users are created as active.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Tomcat and Java/OpenJDK bundled within Jira applications are not updated frequently, and so this may cause troubles to Systems Admins who relies and have to respond to Security Scan checks that may indicates that an old version has vulnerabilities. 

h3. Suggested Solution
_Include newer versions of Tomcat, Java/OpenJDK with smaller releases (more frequently) since old versions have vulnerabilities on them._

h3. Why This Is Important
_Many companies today often runs vulnerability tests, with the intent of proactively find and fix security breaches, and so System Admins are required to implement the needed fixes for those. Adding newer versions of Tomcat and Java/OpenJDK to smaller releases more frequently would save system admins from having to manually install newer versions to fix vulnerabilities on a regular basis._

h3. Workaround
Current workaround is manually upgrade Tomcat and Java/OpenJDK, as described in below documents:
* [Change the Java version used by Jira server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-the-java-version-used-by-jira-server-765594330.html] document. 
* [How to upgrade Apache Tomcat version used by Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upgrade-apache-tomcat-version-used-by-jira-879957866.html] document.
fields.summary: As a System Admin, I need newer versions of Tomcat, Java/OpenJDK bundled within smaller releases (more frequently) since old versions have vulnerabilities on them

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a admin edits a workflow from project settings page(plugins/servlet/project-config/FIR/workflows) on Jira environment that runs behind Microsoft Azure Application Gateway's OWASP 3.0 core security rule, the request gets blocked!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Enable Microsoft Azure Application Gateway's OWASP 3.0 core security rule if possible.
- Edit a sample project work from project settings > workflow page.

h3. Expected Results
Call to edit workflow /rest/api/2/mypreferences?key=workflow-mode should not get blocked.

h3. Actual Results
Call to edit workflow gets blocked. Because the request payload not being in json format.
 !Screenshot 2021-08-24 at 2.08.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 

{noformat}
{ "resourceId": "xyz", "operationName": "ApplicationGatewayFirewall", "time": "2021-08-11T07:01:38.6064411Z", "category": "ApplicationGatewayFirewallLog", "properties": {
  "instanceId": "ApplicationGatewayRole_IN_0",
  "clientIp": "10.10.10.10",
  "clientPort": "0",
  "requestUri": "/rest/api/2/mypreferences?key=workflow-mode",
  "ruleSetType": "OWASP",
  "ruleSetVersion": "3.0",
  "ruleId": "0",
  "ruleGroup": "Default",
  "message": "Mandatory rule. Cannot be disabled. Failed to parse request body.",
  "action": "Blocked",
  "site": "Global",
  "details": {
    "message": "Access denied with code 400 (phase 2). Match of \"eq 0\" against \"REQBODY_ERROR\" required.",
    "data": "JSON parsing error: lexical error: invalid char in json text.\\x0a",
    "file": "",
    "line": ""
  },
  "hostname": "jira.whatnot.com",
  "transactionId": "123456789"
}}
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Try writing a rule that neglects this URL and overrides the main rule. Something as suggested in [example here|https://knowledgebase.progress.com/articles/Article/Azure-ApplicationGateway-WAF-blocks-site-sync].
fields.summary: Editing workflow from project settings page gets blocked by Microsoft Azure Application Gateway's OWASP 3.0 core security rule

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a Story is moved from between Sprints multiple times, then the removed Issue is not seen in Burndown chart with Event Details: "Issue removed from sprint".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple Sprints - Sprint 1, Sprint 2, Sprint 3
 # Add Story to all Sprints
 # Start Sprint 1
 # Move one Story from Sprint 1 to Sprint 2
 # Complete Sprint 1
 # Result #1
 # Start Sprint 2
 # Move the same Story (which was moved from Sprint 1) from Sprint 2 to Sprint 3
 # Complete Sprint 2
 # Reult #1

h3. Expected Results
In Result #1, under the Burndown chart for Sprint 1, we should see the Issue tagged with Event details: "Issue removed from sprint"
In Result #2, under the Burndown chart for Sprint 2, we should see the Issue tagged with Event details: "Issue removed from sprint"
h3. Actual Results
In Result #1, under the Burndown chart for Sprint 1, we should see the Issue tagged with Event details: "Issue removed from sprint"
In Result #2, under the Burndown chart for Sprint 2, we DON'T SEE Issue mentioned in the Report tagged with Event details: "Issue removed from sprint"
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Same Story moved between multiple Sprint don't show up in Burn-down chart

The value of the Flagged field in the source issue is being unexpectedly propagated to the new issue.  The current behavior does not square with the documentation provided in [Creating issues and sub-tasks: Cloning an issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver0813/creating-issues-and-sub-tasks-1027135503.html#Creatingissuesandsubtasks-Cloninganissue], and it doesn't seem to make a lot of sense from a business use-case perspective.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Mark an issue as flagged/an impediment
 # Clone this issue
 # Note that the new issue is also flagged.

h3. Expected Results
The new issue should not be flagged.

h3. Actual Results
The new issue is flagged.

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
The close button of the preview issue view on the right side in the backlog, active sprint or kanban board does not receive focus and cannot be reached and operated by keyboard users.
Although it is possible to use the keyboard shortcut 't' to open/close the preview, it is not intuitive, non-experient Jira users tend to use <tab> to reach the objects.

Environment
MacOS/Chrome 92.0.4515.131/Firefox 90.0.1 (64-bits)
Windows/Firefox 90.0.2 (64-bits)/Chrome 92.0.4515.131

h3. Steps to reproduce
* Open a board, for instance, using the keyboard shortcut 'g' + 'a';
* The page will be loaded with the focus at the "Active Sprints" or "Kanban Board";
* Press <tab> to reach the issues and hit <enter> to open the issue at the preview issue view;
* Press <tab> to reach the close button and close the preview.

h3. Expected results
* it should be possible to reach the close button and hit <enter> to close the preview.

h3. What is observed
* The close button does not receive focus.

h3. Workaround
Use the Keyboard shortcut 't' to open/close the preview.
fields.summary: Accessibility - Keyboard users cannot reach the close button in the preview issue view

jira-board-plugin API's for example: *hasBoardForProject(long projectId)* method is declared in *BoardManager* Interface and implemented by *BoardManagerImpl* inside package *com.atlassian.jira.board* are not used or practically and refers *boardproject* table where we internally store nothing at all.

For Jira API only use API's listed here:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Repository syncing having huge commits keeps syncing for days without any progress. Needs restart to flush the state and get the new updates. It appears as if it is not doing anything just refresh icon on the UI keep rotating.

!repoSyncStuck.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Enable DVCS account and configure it with huge organization or repos having hight number of commit activity.
 - Keep it syncing.

h3. Expected Results
 - Sync started for the repo in discussion should end in desired period of time.

h3. Actual Results
 - It keeps of on syncing with like how it appears in the UI:
 !repoSyncStuck.png|thumbnail!
 - It does not get recent commits/PRs to Jira issues altogether within this period until servers restarted.

h3. Workaround
 - -There is no easy workaround for it except server restart. We are working to find out ways to flush the cache programatically. Will need a feature request for that.- UPDATE: as of 8.13.11, there is an internal REST method for aborting sync for a given repo: POST /\{id}/abortRunningSync
 - Disable/Enable the plugin to clear progressMap cache entirely, which has progress info of this and all repository in sync. But this is too hectic as it has 41 components as of 8.13.
fields.summary: DVCS account with repo having hight commit count(or huge org size) gets stuck frequently while syncing

fields.description:
Currently, if you access a Story with several sub-tasks, the *Story's Issue View Screen* will display the *Sub-tasks* section, where all sub-tasks of this issue are displayed.

 !Screen Shot 2021-07-22 at 16.45.17.png|thumbnail! 

If we consider the ranking of issues, this section gives users the impression that by altering the order of the issues in the *Sub-tasks* section, you would be altering the sub-tasks' *Rank*. 

However, according to the documentation article below, in order to rank an issue, you must access the backlog and re-order the issues in the backlog/active sprint instead:

[Ranking an issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/ranking-an-issue-938845565.html]

Additionally, you perform this procedure and you receive no response from the application, an error message, or a warning, as the application does not include any feedback to the user, causing a terrible customer experience, as the expectations from our users are not aligned with the product's design.

Including this functionality, would certainly increase Jira's value to these teams and help them implement what they are looking for.

Let us know if you have other questions, or if there is anything else we may be of assistance.
fields.summary: Allow users to alter sub-tasks' Rank through their parent issue's Issue View Screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Following an upgrade of Jira to 8.14 or newer, links of commits, branches, pull requests and repositories from all organizations will point to the first organization of the list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Jira 8.13 or earlier, setup two DVCS organizations that point to different base URLs. For instance, GitLab and GitHub Enterprise. 
# Upgrade Jira to 8.14 or newer. 

h3. Expected Results
The DVCS links are unchanged. 

h3. Actual Results
All DVCS links from GitHub Enterprise will point to gitlab.com as base 

h3. Workaround
Delete and re-create all organizations but the first one. 
(!) Once an organization is created, it may take time for the sync to finish so you need to notify your users that some development information will be unavailable for some time. 
(i) We recommend you test the sync in a lower environment to get a sense of the timing it takes. Assuming both environments are similar in terms of specs, you may also want to add a 50% buffer to the timing because the sync performance is impacted by the usage of Jira.
fields.summary: Upgrading Jira to 8.14 makes all DVCS links from all organizations point to the first orgranization in the list

fields.description:
h3. Problem

After writing a comment on a subtask, but before submitting it, if the 'back' navigation is triggered, we get a warning with a chance to cancel or hit ok, but either way, the 'back' continues, and the comment is lost.
h3. Environment

Found in 8.5.4 and 8.13.6

only tested on Mac
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a non-epic issue that has a subtask.
 2. Click on a subtask.
 3. Open the comment box and type some text. Do not submit the comment.
 4. Click on the back button
 5. Click "Cancel" on the dialog box that pops up.
h3. Expected Results

The 'back' is cancelled and the comment is preserved
h3. Actual Results

We are sent back to the parent task and the comment is lost
h3. Workaround

No workaround
h3. Notes

Reproduced in Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Vivaldi
 * The warning about going back is specific to Jira and mentions the comment.
 * If you hit 'back' on a subtask that was not opened exactly according to these instructions, you will get a generic 'leave the page' warning, and that works as expected (can be canceled properly)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Burndown Chart is not summing up the subtasks estimation when using Original Time Estimate set on the board.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a classic Scrum project
# Access the estimation configuration on the board and set it to *Original Time Estimate*
# Create some stories and add subtasks to them
# Add time estimation to the stories and subtasks
# Create a sprint, add the stories created to the sprint and start it
# See the Burndown chart

h3. Expected Results

According to the [Burndown chart documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/burndown-chart-777002653.html], the expected behavior is:

||Subtask behavior when _remaining estimate and time spent_ is enabled||Subtask behavior when remaining estimate and time spent is disabled||
|If you add a subtask to an issue that's already in an active sprint, the subtask is treated as scope change. The scope change is also indicated in the Burndown Chart.|If you add a subtask to an issue that's already in an active sprint, the subtask is also treated as scope change. However, scope change is not indicated in the Burndown Chart for the subtask.|
|Time estimates of subtasks are rolled up to the parent task. This means that the parent task will have the total sum of all remaining estimates of the subtasks.|Time estimates are tracked individually across the subtasks and the parent task itself.|

h3. Actual Results

The actual results are:

* If you select the option "Original Time Estimate" as a parameter in the Burndown chart report, the subtasks are not displayed and their estimation _is not_ summed up to their parent issue, independently if the option "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent" is enabled or not
*  When the "Remaining Estimate and Time Spent" is enabled, the Burndown chart shows another parameter, "Remaining Time Estimate". If you use this parameter in the report the subtasks are displayed individually in the report.

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Burndown Chart is not summing up and "burning" the subtasks estimation when using Original Time Estimate set on the board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During zero downtime upgrade, when one of the nodes is using Jira 8.17.0, the project permission changes will not be propagated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up a cluster with two nodes, one of them using 8.17.0, the other with 8.16.x or 8.17.1
# Open issue security level permissions in a browser on both nodes to ensure they are cached.
# Change issue security level permissions for a user.

h3. Expected Results

After refresh, both nodes should show the same, updated permissions.

h3. Actual Results

Only the node that originated the change will show the updated permissions.

h3. Workaround

Nodes on 8.17.0 will communicate that change between themselves, but not to other versions. They will also not accept changes from other versions.

Workaround #1: If the permission was updated on the 8.17.0 node, it needs to be repeated on non-8.17.0 nodes (and vice versa).
Workaround #2: If you updated the permission on 8.17.0 node, all non-8.17.0 need to be restarted (this can be a rolling restart). Likewise, if you performed a change on a non-8.17.0 node, 8.17.0 nodes will need to be restarted.


h3. Actions to be taken after ZDU upgrade that involved a 8.17.0 version:

After the last node running 8.17.0 is upgraded/removed from the cluster, restart all nodes in the cluster (this can be a rolling restart).
fields.summary: When changing project permissions, the permissions are not properly propagated

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user tries to create/add organization to already linked DVCS account that requires oAuth authentication(for example: GitLab), using rest API, it creates/adds the org, but fails to list the repos within it and sync it further.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- With your existing Jira install, link DVCS to a self managed GitLab or other version control.
- Make a rest call to add/create org within that DVCS account, using the API as below:
{code:java}
POST /rest/bitbucket/1.0/organization {hostUrl:"http://gitlab.com", dvcsType:"GitLab", displayName:"MyOrg", autolinkNewRepos:"true" , smartcommitsOnNewRepos:"true"}
{code}
(i) This is a sudo code, change this to a curl.

h3. Expected Results

Org should be added to the DVCS account in Jira and all its repos should be listed within it and synced for the first time.

h3. Actual Results

Org gets added, but it does not list any repo and no further sync works.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

*Note*: This happens because the payload to create Organization also expects the credential type info within the body. But, internally, it is not handling the credentials even if we pass along the tokenID within payload. This way it adds the org with UnauthenticatedCredential type where as GitLab that needs oAuth2.0 works with ThreeLeggedOAuthReferenceCredential type.
fields.summary: Creating organization under DVCS account using rest API does not honour oAuth and hence does not work

Should be able to link to the Epic since, there is no changes done on Epic. We are actually updating the Issue field.

It will give an Error:

"You don't have permission to edit this epic, so you can't assign your issue to it."
{code}

fields.description:
We had been seeing clients with large datasets (1 M+), which have issues with re-indexing, even if there's no issues, re-index takes a lot of time, it is a big plus that we can leave the process on one node while we keep using the rest and cause no downtime, but sometimes it would be better to have a faster re-index, even for troubleshooting, waiting hours for a re-index to complete, or finding out that it failed at 70 - 90% progress, it is frustrating for users, admins and even support.

Please add the option to share re-index loads across the nodes servers, a load balancer that could divide work between nodes so their resources are also used to process the same re-index but processing different requests, this should allow system administrators to increase the index threads used, i.e. a 3 node data center Jira Software site with a default usage of 20 index threads (jira-config.properties), that shared between 3 nodes, I would like it to be 60 combined, (I'm not even sure if this is possible both from a developer and infrastructure side), but it should really be a BIGGER plus for the whole Atlassian Jira Data Center community.
fields.summary: Share available nodes CPU for re-index

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there isn't a feature that allows admins to export/import "Fix Version/s"("Releases") in Jira Software projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Implement import/Export feature on the "Fix Version/s" configuration page ("Releases") within Jira Software projects
** e.g. version name, status, release date.
* Allow "Fix Version/s values to be copied along with the Jira issues when performing a bulk change

h3. Why this is important
* Saves admins time when moving Jira issues/tasks from one project to another(bulk operations)
* Potential for discrepancies in the "Fix Version/s" field when moving Jira issues/tasks from one project to another
 
h3. Workaround 
* Manually recreate the "Fix Version/s" in the project settings - ensure that all attributes of each version are identical to the "source" or original "Fix Version/s" values.
fields.summary: Allow "Releases"/"Versions"/"Fix Version/s" to be exported/imported into projects

fields.description:
The various keyboard shortcuts which are made available to us in Jira, are incredibly useful for quick navigation/editing of an open ticket.


However, one is particularly problematic: The "i" shortcut which *immediately performs* an "assign to me" action.

 
h3. The issue

All other shortcuts avaialble will result in non-destructive actions - such as navigating between tickets, opening a dialog for further edits, etc. - or otherwise result in an action which _must be confirmed_ before it is committed. However, this one particular shortcut does not: If the user accidentally hits the "i" key when not in a text-entry field, they _immediately_ have the open bug assigned to them - which may not be as desired, and may result in unexpected notifications, as well as being a bit involved to recover from.

In addition, there is already an "Assign" shortcut ("a") which brings up an edit dialog, and the "Assign to me" action is a simple click (or sometimes, tap of the Enter key) away. This means that the general "Assign" shortcut ("a") - versus the "Assign to me" shortcut ("i") - avoids the potential for unexpected actions, is arguably more powerful/flexible, and is only slightly more-involved to perform.

The problems due to such mistaken keypresses are certainly PEBKAC issues - but it seems that there are _many_ opportunities for mistakes to impact users, which could be obviated if this action were to be slightly changed, and made a bit "safer".

It is a very-common occurrence to hear from users that they change something in Jira *by mistake* because they have typed something which triggers a shortcut. This type of issue should not be so prevalent.
h3. Recommended solution

It would be wonderful if perhaps the repeatedly-problematic "Assign to me" shortcut could be *disabled*, separate from disabling all other shortcuts. As stated above, its functionality can easily be subsumed by the general "Assign" shortcut.

Else, this particular shortcut should be *changed* to require a combination of _modifier keys_ to be performed (similar to "Submit a form = Ctrl + Alt + s"). Perhaps "Ctrl + Alt + a", to build upon and retain the mnemonic for "Assign"?

A simple change such as this could result in a much-better user experience, and avoid the potential for undesired mistakes.
fields.summary: Change/disable keyboard shortcut for immediate-action "Assign to me"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a Jira Admin disables the "Priority" in the Tasks Screenscheme, then Jira doesn't follow the default priority scheme when moving a task to a bug.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on *Project Settings -> Screens;*
 # On the *Task Screenscheme* section, click on the edit icon;
 # Then, click on the Screen that is in use at the moment.
 # Disable the *"Priority"* field. 

h3. Expected Results

Although the Priority field has been disabled from the tickets detail screen, the priority shouldn't change when moving from a task to a bug.
h3. Actual Results

When disabling the Priority field in the Task Screenscheme, Jira will not obey the default priority scheme and, when moving a task to a bug, Jira will pick the first priority that is in the queue (which usually is "Highest")
h3. Workaround

The only workaround so far, if the customer needs to have the priority field disabled for the tickets, is to change the priority positions and move, for example, "Medium" to the first position.
fields.summary: Priority default not used when disabling the priority in tasks screen scheme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we switch workflow designer between "Diagram" and "Text" then

Jira generates requests to remember the user's preference POST to resource:
{code:java}
/rest/api/2/mypreferences?key=workflow-mode
{code}
HTTP header "Content-Type" is set to "application/json", but there is only text without quotes within the body:
 JSON body only has 
{code:java}
text
{code}
which is not JSON compliant.
 Firewall F5 blocks such requests because F5 identifies the request as " JSON Parser Attack"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Jira Project>Workflows
 # Select any workflow and open the workflow designer
 # Start capturing the HAR file
 # Switch between diagram and text mode of workflow 

h3. Expected Results

The POST requests should have a valid JSON request to capture the user preference

h3. Actual Results

Check the HAR file results and you will find a text without quotes which is an invalid JSON file

!image-2021-06-15-13-14-44-275.png|width=198,height=87!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When we switch workflow designer  between "Diagram" and "Text" then it sends a POST request which has invalid json format

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Sometimes the customers write an invalid HTML code into their announcement banner, which causes some pages to load improperly. In most cases, Jira simply shows a blank page on the application without throwing any error. 
 Due to the lack of errors or information about that issue, the customers are unable to identify the problem on their instance which is a time-consuming effort.
 An example of that behavior is described on our [Advanced Roadmaps Plans not showing issues when an Announcement Banner is present in Jira article.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/advanced-roadmaps-plans-not-showing-issues-when-an-announcement-banner-is-present-in-jira-1004940115.html]
h3. Suggested Solution

Create an HTML tag validator such as [W3 Validator|https://validator.w3.org/nu/#textarea] on the Announcement Banner page, to immediately inform the customers that their code is invalid and prevent them to cause failures on Jira. 
h3. Why This Is Important
This could reduce the customer and support efforts to investigate and identify the issue that is happening with the HTML code.
 
h3. Workaround
Get the customer HTML code and check with the W3 Validator or manually.
fields.summary: HTML validator on announcement banner

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The development status summary panel is timing out when under heavy load even if data is available
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect a DVCS integration (Bitbucket, Gitlab or Github) with a linked issue
# Open 30+ tabs that auto-refresh (can use http://www.dummysoftware.com/easy-auto-refresh/?ref=chrome for this)
# In a separate browser open that same issue and refresh a few times until you see an error message about timeout or failure to load under the dev panel:
 !Screenshot 2021-06-09 at 16.22.00.png|thumbnail! 

The following exception is thrown into logs:
{noformat}
2021-06-09 15:02:19,323+0100 http-nio-2990-exec-218 WARN admin 902x36691x25 eeeqnf 127.0.0.1 /rest/dev-status/1.0/issue/summary [c.a.j.p.devstatus.provider.DefaultCoordinator] GitLab (timeout after 5000ms, cached data returned)
{noformat}

There’s only 15 threads max that can fetch DVCS data at a time so this is causing contention:

{code:java}
   this.dvcsDataFetcherExecutor = ThreadPool.builder()
                .name("dvcs." + dvcsType())
                .maxThreads(15)
                .boundedQueue(QUEUE_SIZE)
                .build();
{code}

and the call to timeout. Note that increasing the timeout will not help here.


h3. Expected Results
DVCS data related to the issue should load in the Dev Panel.
h3. Actual Results
Data is not loaded into the dev panel which should return either the cached existing data or the new one stored into DB after soft or hard sync.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The development status summary panel is timing out when under heavy load even if data is available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The issue is observed with Jira-Gitlab DVCS integration offered with Jira 8.14.0.
 For some issues, Commit details are missing and does not appears on the Development even though Pull requests details are fetched from Gitlab to Jira database.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in a project (i.e. TST)
 # Move that issue to another project (i.e. QA)
 # Create a branch with a title such as 'TST-1 QA-6' and another with 'TST-1'
 # Perform a sync
 # There will be a Nullpointer exception error in the logs

h3. Expected Results

The sync should not fail with exception and the Commit information should get displayed on the Development panel.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the _atlassian-jira.log_ file and commit details are not shown on development panel
{code:java}
2021-03-02 10:11:29,258+0300 devstatus.dvcs.gitlabselfmanaged:thread-17 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.p.devstatus.provider.LoggingDecorator] Call 'summary for [TST-6436, TST-4330, TST-7086]' has thrown an exception2021-03-02 10:11:29,258+0300 devstatus.dvcs.gitlabselfmanaged:thread-17 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.p.devstatus.provider.LoggingDecorator] Call 'summary for [TST-6436, TST-4330, TST-7086]' has thrown an exceptionjava.lang.NullPointerException at java.util.AbstractCollection.addAll(AbstractCollection.java:343) at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.dao.impl.querydsl.BranchDaoQueryDsl.lambda$addIssuesToBranches$11(BranchDaoQueryDsl.java:233)
{code}
h3. Workaround
 - Remove any branches with multiple issue keys in the name
fields.summary: Commit details missing on development panel in certain issues when sync is performed with Gitlab Repository

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Due to the nature of our work (which is primarily run support), much of our work carries through multiple sprints. However, the Story Points are calculated and accounted for, in total, only when the issue is Done. For example, I have a piece of work that starts in Sprint 1, estimated at 3 points. That work gets delayed after 2 points are completed, so it's carried into Sprint 2. Even though the issue only has 1 point of work remaining for Sprint 2, all 3 points are calculated into the commitment. In addition, Sprint 1 didn't get credit for the completion of the 2 points.

When an issue is carried to another sprint, the prior sprint is saved and the new sprint is added. A similar feature for Story Points would be helpful and create a better accuracy for when work is completed, and what is left to be done.

The only way I've found to get around this is to close the issue at the end of an iteration and open a new issue, linking the records. However, this makes workflow history more difficult to track. It's also not accurate if it's the same piece of work that needs to be completed.
fields.summary: Count Story Points, per Sprint, for Issues carried into future Sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira can be connected with Bamboo through an Application Link. In some cases, Jira can send requests to Bamboo that are too long for it to handle. When it happens, the "HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request" caused by "Exception java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Request header is too large" error is returned by Bamboo. Both Jira and Bamboo are configured with the "maxHttpHeaderSize" value of "8192 by default (it's an Apache parameter set in the "server.xml" file). Jira should be aware of this default setting and it should adjust the size of its request to match the Bamboo's default "maxHttpHeaderSize" value. It would prevent users from having to troubleshoot this problem and adjusting the "maxHttpHeaderSize" parameter manually.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Jira with Bamboo through an Application Link.
 # Create a large and busy environment. Jira will finally start sending requests that are too long for Bamboo to handle. You can simulate Jira's long request by executing something similar to the following REST API call.
{code:java}

{code}

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo will successfully send the data requested by Jira, because Jira is sending requests that Bamboo can handle.

h3. Actual Results
Bamboo will send the "HTTP Status 400 – Bad Request" caused by "Request header is too large" response to Jira. In some cases, when connecting through proxy/load balancer, you may see the "HTTP status 404 Not Found" being returned by the proxy/load balancer itself. This response hides the underlying "Request header is too large" Bamboo error.

h3. Workaround
You must manually increase the value of the "maxHttpHeaderSize" parameter in the "<Bamboo_Install_Directory>/conf/server.xml" and restart Bamboo to apply the new setting.
fields.summary: Jira can send requests that are too long to handle by a default Bamboo configuration

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
The Commitment value is reducing after the sprint start. Checking the documentation about the Velocity Chart, it's stated that: 
Commitment: The gray bar for each sprint shows the total estimate of all issues in the sprint when it begins. After the sprint has started, any stories added to the sprint, or any changes made to estimates, will not be included in this total. 
However, if we change the Story Points of an issue (even after completing the sprint) the value of the Commitment is changed. 

We tested on two vanilla instances over the "Create Project with Sample Issues". Kindly follow the Commitment reduction on the attached images.

h3. Environment
Jira 8.15.1 
Jira 8.7

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a new Sprint
* Add issues to the Sprint
* Start the Sprint
* End the sprint
* Change the value of the Story Points with one of the issues that belong to the sprint to any value
* The Story Points of that issue will stop to be considered on the Velocity Chart


h3. Expected Results
After starting the sprint the Commitment should be the same forever.

h3. Actual Results
The Commitment changes if we change the Story Point of the issues that belong to the Sprint.

h3. Workaround
No workaround found.
fields.summary: Commitment value is changing after sprint start.

fields.description:
When there are multiple PI/BRP values - All WSJF values should export by PI/BRP.  Today, if there is more than one PI/BRP identified on a Product/Journey Epic, the WSJF will not export.  See research ticket for more detail:

[https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/51/ALIGNSP-9388]
fields.summary: WSJF Values should export regardless of PI/BRPs selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Delete sprint dialog says I need "*Start/close sprint"* permissions which is not true.
"*Start/Complete Sprints*" permission should not allow deleting the sprint.
"*Manage Sprints*" permission should allow deleting sprint.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create user - *User1*.
 # Remove his "*Edit Sprints*" permission.
 # Remove his "*Manage Sprints*" permission.
 # Create Jira Software scrum project.
 # Create sprint - *Sprint1*.
 # Start *Sprint1*.
 # Stop *Sprint1*.
 # Log in Jira as *User1.*
 # Go to *Sprint Report*.
 # Open context dialog from Delete sprint button.

h3. Expected Results

The dialog should present information like that -  You need "Manage Sprints" permission for all projects ....
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-05-31-09-38-00-136.png!
h3. Workaround

not exist
fields.summary: Delete sprint dialog says I need "Start/close sprint" permissions which is not true
